projects.name: Pixr
projects.description: Developed a photo-sharing platform that enables users to upload images and organize them into collections or galleries. Pixr ensures secure user authentication using Passport.js that enables users to create accounts, log in securely, and personalize their profiles. Pixr utilizes Multer middleware to handle file uploads seamlessly. Used MongoDB as the primary database to store various types of data related. Its document-based structure allows for flexible storage of data in JSON-like documents.

projects.name: QrGen
projects.description: Built a React application enabling users to generate QR codes by providing text input. Utilized QR code library to convert text into QR code images. Implemented QR code scanning functionality, enabling users to scan QR codes from both image files and using devices webcam. Handled react-qr-reader library for QR code scanning. Designed features to allow users to download generated QR codes as images. Displayed QR code images for easy download, enhancing user convenience and accessibility.

experiences.description: Solved the algorithmic doubts of more than 100 students. Provided detailed explanations for problem solutions through written explanations and online meetings.

full_output.name: Ashish Bhatt

Obtained AIR of 211 and global rank 1342 out of 20000+ participants in Codeforces Round 917 (Div. 2).
